question_text: Which of the following best describes 'random access storage' in a hard drive?
answer_options: Data can only be written sequentially
Data is accessed in a random pattern to prevent wear
Data is accessed directly from any location on the drive
Data must be read from start to end every time
correct_answer: Data is accessed directly from any location on the drive
explanation: Random access means the drive can jump to any location without needing to read all preceding data, unlike sequential storage.
